name: Translator-Testing-Model
description:
Data model to formalize the structure of test assets, cases, suites and related metadata
applied to run the diverse polymorphic testing objectives for the Biomedical Data Translator system.
title: Translator Testing Data Model

string.name: string
notes: In RDF serializations, a slot with range of string is treated as a literal or type xsd:string.   If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "string".

integer.name: integer
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "integer".

boolean.name: boolean
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "boolean".

float.name: float
float.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "float".

double.name: double
double.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "double".

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "decimal".

time.name: time
time.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners do not work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "time".

date.name: date
date.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date".

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description: The combination of a date and time
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "datetime".

date_or_datetime.name: date_or_datetime
date_or_datetime.description: Either a date or a datetime
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date_or_datetime".

uriorcurie.name: uriorcurie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uriorcurie".

curie.name: curie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "curie".
comments: in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

uri.name: uri
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uri".
comments: in RDF serializations a slot with range of uri is treated as a literal or type xsd:anyURI unless it is an identifier or a reference to an identifier, in which case it is translated directly to a node

ncname.name: ncname
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "ncname".

objectidentifier.name: objectidentifier
objectidentifier.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "objectidentifier".
comments: Used for inheritance and type checking

nodeidentifier.name: nodeidentifier
nodeidentifier.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "nodeidentifier".

jsonpointer.name: jsonpointer
jsonpointer.description: A string encoding a JSON Pointer. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to a valid object within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpointer".

jsonpath.name: jsonpath
jsonpath.description: A string encoding a JSON Path. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpath".

sparqlpath.name: sparqlpath
sparqlpath.description: A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "sparqlpath".

SMURF.description: Subject Matter User Reasonably Familiar, generally Translator-internal biomedical science expert

GitHubUserFeedback.description: Git hub hosted issue from which a test asset/case/suite may be derived.

TACT.description: Technical Advisory Committee, generally posting semantic use cases as Translator Feedback issues

TranslatorTeam.description: Translator funded KP or ARA team generating test assets/cases/suites for their resources.

TestDataLocation.description: Current SRI_Testing-like test data edges specific to KP or ARA components

TestEnvEnum.name: TestEnvEnum
TestEnvEnum.description: Testing environments within which a TestSuite is run by a TestRunner scheduled by the TestHarness.

FileFormatEnum.name: FileFormatEnum
FileFormatEnum.description: Text file formats for test data sources.

ExpectedOutputEnum.name: ExpectedOutputEnum
ExpectedOutputEnum.description: Expected output values for instances of Test Asset or Test Cases(?). (Note: does this Enum overlap with 'ExpectedResultsEnum' below?)

SemanticSeverityEnum.name: SemanticSeverityEnum
SemanticSeverityEnum.description: From Jenn's worksheet, empty or ill defined (needs elaboration)

ExpectedResultsEnum.name: ExpectedResultsEnum
ExpectedResultsEnum.description: Does this Enum overlap with 'ExpectedOutputEnum' above?

include_good.description: The query should return the result in this test case

exclude_bad.description: The query should not return the result in this test case

NodeEnum.name: NodeEnum
NodeEnum.description: Target node of a Subject-Predicate-Object driven query

TestPersonaEnum.name: TestPersonaEnum
TestPersonaEnum.description: User persona context of a given test.

Clinical.description: An MD or someone working in the clinical field.

LookUp.description: Looking for an answer for a specific patient.

Mechanistic.description: Someone working on basic biology questions or drug discoveries where the study of the biological mechanism.

test_entity_parameters.name: test_entity_parameters
test_entity_parameters.description: One or more parameters documenting target characteristics of a TestEntity.

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.description: Date time when a given entity was created.

id.name: id
id.description: A unique identifier for a Test Entity

name.name: name
name.description: A human-readable name for a Test Entity

description.name: description
description.description: A human-readable description for a Test Entity

tags.name: tags
tags.description: A human-readable tags for categorical memberships of a TestEntity (preferably a URI or CURIE). Typically used to aggregate instances of TestEntity into formally typed or ad hoc lists.

test_source.name: test_source
test_source.description: Provenance of a specific set of test assets, cases and/or suites.

test_reference.name: test_reference
test_reference.description: Document URL where original test source particulars are registered (e.g. Github repo)

test_objective.name: test_objective
test_objective.description: Testing objective behind specified set of test particulars (e.g. acceptance pass/fail; benchmark; quantitative)

must_pass_date.name: must_pass_date
must_pass_date.description: The date by which this test must pass

must_pass_environment.name: must_pass_environment
must_pass_environment.description: The deployment environment within which this test must pass.

scientific_question.name: scientific_question
scientific_question.description: The full human-readable scientific question a SME would ask, which is encoded into the test asset.

examples.value: What drugs may treat multiple sclerosis?

string_entry.name: string_entry
string_entry.description: The object of the core triple to be tested

direction.name: direction
direction.description: The direction of the expected query result triple

answer_informal_concept.name: answer_informal_concept
answer_informal_concept.description: An answer that is returned from the test case, note: this must be combined with the expected_result to form a complete answer.  It might make sense to couple these in their own object instead of strictly sticking to the flat schema introduced by the spreadsheet here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1yj7zIchFeVl1OHqL_kE_pqvzNLmGml_FLbHDs-8Yvig/edit#gid=0

expected_result.name: expected_result
expected_result.description: The expected result of the query

top_level.name: top_level
top_level.description: The answer must return in these many results

query_node.name: query_node
query_node.description: The node of the (templated) TRAPI query to replace

test_env.name: test_env
test_env.description: Deployment environment within which the associated TestSuite is run.

test_assets.name: test_assets
test_assets.description: List of explicitly enumerated Test Assets. The class attributes of TestAsset would be included in the TestCase versus being referred to by the identifier (curie) of the TestAsset. That is, this would be a list of objects (in JSONSchema serialization) versus a list of strings (where each string is an identifier pointing to another class).

trapi_template.name: trapi_template
trapi_template.description: A template for a query, which can be used to generate a query for a test case.  note: the current enumerated values for this slot come from the Benchmarks repo config/benchmarks.json "templates" collection and refer to the "name" field of each template.  Templates themselves are currently stored in the config/[source_name]/templates directory.

components.name: components
components.description: The component that this test case is intended to run against.  Most often this is the ARS for  acceptance tests, but for the Benchmarks repo integration, this can also be individual components of the system like Aragorn, or ARAX.

test_data_file_locator.name: test_data_file_locator
test_data_file_locator.description: An web accessible file resource link to test entity data (e.g. a web accessible text file of Test Asset entries)

test_data_file_format.name: test_data_file_format
test_data_file_format.description: File format of test entity data (e.g. TSV, YAML or JSON)

test_metadata.name: test_metadata
test_metadata.description: Test metadata describes the external provenance, cross-references and objectives for a given test.

test_persona.name: test_persona
test_persona.description: A Test persona describes the user or operational context of a given test.

test_cases.name: test_cases
test_cases.description: List of explicitly enumerated Test Cases.

test_suite_specification.name: test_suite_specification
test_suite_specification.description: Declarative specification of a Test Suite of Test Cases whose generation is deferred, (i.e. within a Test Runner) or whose creation is achieved by stream processing of an external data source.

test_run_parameters.name: test_run_parameters
test_run_parameters.description: Parameters for TestRunnerConfiguration that inform the TestHarness and TestRunners about the general characteristics of a test run.

test_suite_id.name: test_suite_id
test_suite_id.description: CURIE id of a TestSuite registered in the system.

test_case_result.name: test_case_result
test_case_result.description: Encoded result of a single test run of a given test case

test_runner_name.name: test_runner_name
test_runner_name.description: Global system name of a TestRunner.

test_entities.name: test_entities
test_entities.description: One or more instances of TestEntity, generally of class TestAsset, TestCase or TestSuite.

test_case_results.name: test_case_results
test_case_results.description: One or more instances of TestCaseResult.

TestEntityParameter.name: TestEntityParameter
TestEntityParameter.description: A single 'tag = value' pair (where 'value' is a simple string).

TestEntity.name: TestEntity
TestEntity.description: Abstract global 'identification' class shared as a parent with all major model classes within the data model for Translator testing.

id.name: id
id.description: A unique identifier for a Test Entity

name.name: name
name.description: A human-readable name for a Test Entity

description.name: description
description.description: A human-readable description for a Test Entity

tags.name: tags
tags.description: A human-readable tags for categorical memberships of a TestEntity (preferably a URI or CURIE). Typically used to aggregate instances of TestEntity into formally typed or ad hoc lists.

TestMetadata.name: TestMetadata
TestMetadata.description: Represents metadata related to (external SME, SMURF, Translator feedback,  large scale batch, etc.) like the provenance of test assets, cases and/or suites.

test_source.name: test_source
test_source.description: Provenance of a specific set of test assets, cases and/or suites.

test_reference.name: test_reference
test_reference.description: Document URL where original test source particulars are registered (e.g. Github repo)

test_objective.name: test_objective
test_objective.description: Testing objective behind specified set of test particulars (e.g. acceptance pass/fail; benchmark; quantitative)

id.description: A unique identifier for a Test Entity

name.name: name
name.description: A human-readable name for a Test Entity

tags.name: tags
tags.description: A human-readable tags for categorical memberships of a TestEntity (preferably a URI or CURIE). Typically used to aggregate instances of TestEntity into formally typed or ad hoc lists.

TestAsset.name: TestAsset
TestAsset.description: Represents a Test Asset, which is a single specific instance of TestCase-agnostic semantic parameters representing the specification of a Translator test target with inputs and (expected) outputs.

tags.name: tags
tags.description: One or more 'tags' slot values (inherited from TestEntity) should generally be defined to specify TestAsset membership in a "Block List" collection

runner_settings.name: runner_settings
runner_settings.description: Settings for the test harness, e.g. "inferred"

test_reference.name: test_reference
test_reference.description: Document URL where original test source particulars are registered (e.g. Github repo)

TestCase.name: TestCase
TestCase.description: Represents a single enumerated instance of Test Case, derived from a  given collection of one or more TestAsset instances (the value of the 'test_assets' slot) which define the 'inputs' and 'outputs' of the TestCase, used to probe a particular test condition.

test_assets.description: One or more 'tags' slot values (inherited from TestEntity) should generally be defined as filters to specify TestAsset membership in 'test_assets' slot ("Block List") collection.
